title: Analyze Facebook comment sentiment with GPT-4, Slack, Sheets & Outlook reports
description:
## üìä Description
Automatically analyze the sentiment of Facebook posts and their audience comments using GPT-4 to identify trends and potential PR risks. üß†üí¨
 This workflow fetches recent posts via the Facebook Graph API, performs AI-powered sentiment analysis on both posts and comments, routes negative results to Slack for immediate attention, logs all data into Google Sheets, and sends a beautifully formatted sentiment summary report via Outlook. üìàüìß

## What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Trigger ‚Äì Runs daily at 10 AM to fetch the latest Facebook posts. ‚è∞
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Data Extraction ‚Äì Pulls post text, reactions, and up to 100 comments per post using Facebook Graph API. üì≤
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Formatting ‚Äì Structures and cleans Facebook data for AI analysis. üß©
 4Ô∏è‚É£ AI Sentiment Analysis ‚Äì GPT-4 evaluates post tone and audience sentiment with confidence scores and explanations. ü§ñ
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Routing ‚Äì Sends negative sentiment alerts directly to Slack for quick response. ‚ö†Ô∏è
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Logging ‚Äì Records all sentiment metrics in Google Sheets, including positivity ratio and engagement data. üìä
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Reporting ‚Äì Generates a color-coded HTML email report and delivers it via Outlook. üíå
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Error Handling ‚Äì Sends Slack alerts if any node in the workflow fails. üõ°Ô∏è

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Monitors brand reputation automatically across Facebook comments
 ‚úÖ Provides structured AI sentiment reports for data-driven decisions
 ‚úÖ Flags negative audience sentiment for timely intervention
 ‚úÖ Maintains an always-updated sentiment log in Google Sheets
 ‚úÖ Delivers professional HTML summary emails to teams

## Features
- Automated daily trigger for post sentiment scanning
- Facebook Graph API integration for posts and comments
- GPT-4‚Äìpowered comment tone and sentiment scoring
- Slack notifications for negative sentiment alerts
- Google Sheets sentiment dashboard logging
- Beautiful HTML report delivery through Microsoft Outlook
- Built-in error detection with Slack fallback alerts

## Requirements
- Facebook Graph API credentials with pages_read_engagement access
- OpenAI API key for GPT-4 or GPT-4o
- Slack Bot token with chat:write permission
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with edit rights
- Microsoft Outlook OAuth2 credentials for email delivery

## Target Audience
- Social media and marketing teams monitoring brand perception üì£
- PR teams managing engagement or audience sentiment üßæ
- Analysts building data dashboards from engagement metrics üìä
- Agencies offering automated reporting for client pages üßë‚Äçüíº

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Facebook Graph API credentials and set your page ID.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Add OpenAI credentials for GPT-4 sentiment analysis.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Configure Slack and provide your channel ID for alerts.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Set Google Sheets credentials and specify sheet ID and name.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Microsoft Outlook for email report delivery.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Adjust the daily schedule (default 10 AM) as needed.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Run once manually to verify setup, then enable automation. ‚úÖ
disclaimer: This workflow is provided as-is. Please review and test before using in production.
